revised_title: A Reassessment of the Morphology of the Middle Cambrian Lobopod Animal Aysheaia Pedunculata
tldr: The author examines the morphology of the Middle Cambrian lobopod animal Aysheaia pedunculata, using fifteen prepared and photographed specimens to provide a detailed analysis of its body structure, appendages, and annulations. The study offers a new reconstruction of the animal and suggests how it may have lived within a Cambrian marine community, alongside various arthropods and other bizarre forms.
